title: Fantasy football sizzlers, fizzlers: Daniel Jones was great in Week 8
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: Believe it or not we have all but reached the halfway point of the NFL regular season. As Lorenzo Reyes details, the league's elite class is starting to crystalize. USA TODAY

These players saw their fantasy values increase or decrease most based on their performances in Week 8:

Sizzlers

RB Aaron Jones, Green Bay Packers: Green Bay has found a running game by effectively utilizing both Jones and Jamaal Williams. Jones had 226 yards combined and two touchdowns and had another long score called back due to a penalty.

RB Tevin Coleman, San Francisco 49ers: Coleman had four total touchdowns in a rout of Carolina. With Arizona up next on Thursday, Coleman should be glued into lineups everywhere.

WR Mike Evans, Tampa Bay Buccaneers: Evans can catch anything thrown in his vicinity, as evidenced by him hauling in 11 of 12 targets for 198 yards and a pair of touchdowns.

WR Cooper Kupp, Los Angeles Rams: Kupp has been a master at finding seams in the defense, torching the Bengals for 220 yards and a touchdown. His success is overshadowed the other Rams receivers.

QB Daniel Jones, New York Giants: With critics wondering if he should remain the starter, Jones provided a clear answer with a 322-yard passing performance with four touchdowns and no interceptions.

Giants quarterback Daniel Jones had the best passing day of his young career on Sunday in Detroit, completing 28-of-41 for 322 yards and four touchdowns. (Photo: Raj Mehta, USA TODAY Sports)

Fizzlers

RB Le'Veon Bell, New York Jets: Bell has struggled to succeed in a slumping offense. With the Miami Dolphins up next, a lot is riding on coach Adam Gase. If Bell doesn't produce again, that's on the coaching staff.

WR Larry Fitzgerald, Arizona Cardinals: Even in a blowout loss, Fitzgerald was once again an afterthought with two receptions on four targets for 8 yards. With San Francisco up next, things don't get any easier.

WR Corey Davis, Tennesee Titans: The switch at quarterback to Ryan Tannehill and the apparent chemistry he had with Davis in Week 7 was apparently a mirage. Davis secured just two receptions for 9 yards against the 31st-ranked Tampa Bay pass defense.

TE Zach Ertz, Philadelphia Eagles: Catching just two passes for 20 yards, Ertz once again took a back seat in the offense. It's mind-boggling to see Dallas Goedert more involved in the game plan.

RB Ty Johnson, Detroit Lions: Last week's waiver wire darling turned into a pumpkin. Even though Detroit rotated four running backs, Johnson led the group with 3.6 yards per carry. Kerryon Johnson's touches seem to have been replaced by a fantasy-unfriendly committee.
description: New York Giants quarterback Daniel Jones throws for a career-high four touchdowns, while Philadelphia Eagles tight end Zach Ertz continues to struggle.
